util

Class Timestamp

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.Timestamp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Timestamp>

    public class Timestamp
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Timestamp>
    a simple class to manage our days. It does not represent a calenderday but rather a working day with a worktime, which is the standard worktime diminished by the overtime of the day before

        public static Timestamp beginningOfDay(int day)
        Returns:

      • getNextDay

        public Timestamp getNextDay()
        This function initializes the next day based on the current day it automatically passes the time that was worked too much today
        Returns:
        timestamp at the beginning of the next Day

      • isInOvertime

        public boolean isInOvertime()
        checks whether this timestamp has exceeded the working hours of the day.
        Returns:
        true if the next day will have to adjust its working hours because of overtime in this day.

      • isAtBeginning

        public boolean isAtBeginning()
        Checks whether this timestamp is at the beginning of a day.
        Returns:
        true if the time of this timestamp equals 0.

      • shouldBeFinishedAfter

        public boolean shouldBeFinishedAfter(int additionalTime)
        inspector that calculates that the day should be finished if we add additional time to this day
        Parameters:
        additionalTime -
        Returns:
        true if current time + additionalTime >= today's worktime

      • shouldBeFinished

        public boolean shouldBeFinished()
        inspector that calculates if the day should be finished base on the current time
        Returns:
        true if current time >= today's worktime
